lines.content: # I would like to join this list. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
* The main controller for the Lumi task manager chatbot.
* This class facilitates interactions between the user and the chatbot through command-line commands.
* @param filePath The path to the text file where tasks will be stored.
* Continuously reads user commands from the command-line, processes commands and updates the task list.
* The loop terminates when the user enters bye, and the task list is saved to the text file.
throw new LumiException("Please provide a task number e.g. mark 1");
throw new LumiException("Please enter a valid task number");
throw new LumiException("Please enter a number after 'mark'/'unmark'");
throw new LumiException("Please add the task number!");
* Creates a new {@code Lumi} instance with the given filepath.
* This class represents an exception specific to the Lumi application.
* This exception is thrown when Lumi encounters an error related to
* invalid input, storage issues, or other application specific problems.
* Constructs a new LumiException with the specified message.
* @param message The message that describes the nature of the exception.
* Utility class for parsing and formatting date-time strings used in Lumi.
* This class accepts multiple date formats and provides a standard output format
private static final DateTimeFormatter RETURN_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MM yyyy HH:mm");
* Parses the given string into a {@link LocalDateTime} format and returns the {@link LocalDateTime}
* @param date_time The string to be parsed.
* @throws DateTimeParseException If the string is not in an accepted format.
public static LocalDateTime parseDate(String date_time) throws DateTimeParseException {
throw new DateTimeParseException("Please enter a date in the correct format", date_time, 0);
* Returns the given {@link LocalDateTime} in the standard output format.
* @param local_date_time The {@Link LocalDateTime} to be formatted in the standard output format.
* @return A formatted date-time string in {@code dd MM yyyy HH:mm} format.
* Utility class for parsing raw user input into {@Link Task} objects.
* The {@code Parser} analyzes the command string and determines the correct task type to instantiate.
* If no suitable task types are found, a LumiException will be thrown.
* Parses the given input string and creates the corresponding Task.
* @param desc The raw input given by the user.
* @throws LumiException If the input is malformed or does not match a valid command.
public static Task parse(String desc) throws LumiException {
throw new LumiException("Please add a task in the format: todo <task>\n"
+ "event <task> /from <dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm or dd MM yyyy HH:mm> "
+ "/to <dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm or dd MM yyyy HH:mm");
throw new LumiException("Oh no! >.<\nI'm not sure what this is, please try again!");
* This class handles storage of {@Link Task} objects.
* The Storage class is responsible for loading a date in a given file into a {@Link TaskList}

* Creates a new {@Link Storage} object associated with the given file path.
* @param filePath The path to the text file used for storage.
* Loads all tasks from the file into a list of tasks.
* If the file does not exist, a new file is created.
* If a line is invalid, it will be ignored.
* @return A {@Link List<Task>} containing the tasks read from the file.
* @throws IOException If there is an error creating or reading the file.
* @throws LumiException If the task line cannot be parsed correctly.
public List<Task> load() throws IOException, LumiException {

* Writes the current list of tasks back into the storage file.

* This class represents a {@code Deadline} task that has a description and the associated due date and times.
* The input string is validated and parsed into a {@link LocalDateTime} using {@link DateTimeParser}.
* If the input is malformed, a {@link LumiException} is thrown.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} from the given user input string.
* @param desc User input containing the task description and the deadline.
* @throws LumiException If the input string is unable to be parsed successfully.
throw new LumiException("Please enter a deadline task "
* This class represents a {@code Event} task that has a description and associated start and end dates and times.
* The input string is validated and parsed into a {@link LocalDateTime} using {@link DateTimeParser}.
* If the input is malformed, a {@link LumiException} is thrown.
* Constructs an {@link Event} task from the given user input string.
* @param desc User input containing the task description and the event duration.
* @throws LumiException If the input string is unable to be parsed successfully.
throw new LumiException("Please enter an event task in the "
* This class represents a generic task in the Lumi application.
* {@code Task} objects can be marked as done or undone, and their state will be reflected in their
* Subclasses may extend this class to include additional information such as deadlines or event periods.
* Constructs a new {@code Task} object with the give {@link TaskType}.
* @param taskType The type of this task.
* Marks the current {@code Task} object as done.
* @throws LumiException If the task could not be marked as done.
throw new LumiException("This task has already been marked done");
* Marks the current {@code Task} object as undone.
* @throws LumiException If the task could not be marked as undone.
throw new LumiException("This task has already been marked undone");

* @param taskList The list of tasks to initialize with.

* Represents the different types of tasks supported by Lumi.
* Each type has a corresponding string representation.
* Creates a {@link TaskType} with the given label.
* @param label The string representation of the task type.
* This class represents a {@code Todo} task that has a description.
* If the input is malformed, a {@link LumiException} is thrown.

* Handles all user interaction messages for the application.
* Provides methods to display greeting, goodbye, delete, mark, unmark and error messages.
System.out.println("Hello from " + LOGO + "\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints a delete message with the description of the deleted task.
* @param task The task that had been deleted.
System.out.println("This task has been deleted: " + task.toString());
* Prints a message after the given {@link Task} has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that had been marked.
System.out.println("Yay! I've marked your task done: " + task);
* Prints a message after the given {@link Task} has been unmarked.
* @param task The task that had been unmarked.
System.out.println("Oki, I've marked your task undone: " + task);
* Prints an error message for a failed load.
* @param e The exception thrown from the failed load attempt.
System.out.println("Unable to load your file: " + e.getMessage() + "\n" + "Starting with a new list...");

tasks.add("deadline test /by 12/10/2025 16:00"); // tests if deadline task has been added
tasks.add("event party /from 12/01/2025 15:00 /to 13/01/2025 15:00"); // tests if event task has been added
